title: [Question] SKIPPING ISAS, PROBLEMATIC OR NO?
content: If you skip an ISA what happens? do they give us a retest or a 0? could someone answer ASAP

comments.body:
0
If you have a genuine medical reason then you can reach out to the chancellor/department HOD (preferably with parents for more seriousness) & they might exempt you from it and calculate your grade based on other isa, esa and assignments for that subject

Depends on the reason. The process is generally very long.... if your reason is genuine, u need prior approval of missing isa. Usually if ur skipping isa due to major health issues(in some cases appealing after also works), conferences/representing college in sports.
Ur missed isa weightage is added to esa. lets say U missed isa 1, which is 20% of ur grade. esa is usually 50% of ur grade. so instead isa 1 is ignored and the 20% is added to ur esa weightage i.e 70% of ur grade.

If you missed due to some non genuine reason. Ull get zero.

Also there is no retest for isa

Been there done that, I do not recommend it at all. I had a very valid reason (I was very sick) but I still had to go through a lengthy process of countless letters to HOD and head of examinations etc. 

They ended up considering a higher percentage of the ESA marks for one of the subject. Overall it messed up with my grade so best avoid skipping any ISA.
